message_1:
Using predicate logic, write a statement that represents the following problem:

There are 6 apples and 7 oranges in the basket.

Then, the task for the math student would be to translate the statement above into predicate logic notation.
message_2:
Let A(x) represent "x is an apple" and O(x) represent "x is an orange". We can use the existential quantifier (∃) to represent the existence of apples and oranges in the basket. The problem can be represented as:

∃x1, x2, x3, x4, x5, x6, y1, y2, y3, y4, y5, y6, y7 (A(x1) ∧ A(x2) ∧ A(x3) ∧ A(x4) ∧ A(x5) ∧ A(x6) ∧ O(y1) ∧ O(y2) ∧ O(y3) ∧ O(y4) ∧ O(y5) ∧ O(y6) ∧ O(y7))

The task for the math student would be to translate the statement "There are 6 apples and 7 oranges in the basket" into the predicate logic notation provided above.
